meanings.definition: To save more than is necessary or prudent.
meanings.sent1: She tends to oversave her allowance, leaving very little for fun activities.
meanings.sent2: It is important to not oversave for retirement and forget to enjoy life in the present.
meanings.sent3: Tom's friends teased him for his tendency to oversave, calling him the 'penny-pincher' of the group.
meanings.sent4: Her habit of oversaving money was like storing up for a rainy day that never came.
meanings.sent5: The image of her oversaving every penny was etched in his mind, a cautionary tale of excess frugality.

meanings.definition: To be excessively frugal or thrifty.
meanings.sent1: He tends to oversave on groceries, buying only the cheapest items available.
meanings.sent2: Some people oversave out of fear of not having enough money in the future.
meanings.sent3: The family joked that Grandma's habit of oversaving on heating led to everyone wearing extra layers indoors.
meanings.sent4: Her oversaving ways were like a shield against any unexpected financial emergencies.
meanings.sent5: The town knew him as the man who would oversave on everything, from clothes to food, never indulging in luxuries.
